text: task 5 listen to the conversation for
the last time be prepared to answer
specific questions about the events that
took place at work and the speaker's
feelings about those events
did you hear Pam today at lunch you mean
how she went on and on about how she
should have gotten the promotion instead
of Rick yeah she thinks she's more

experience not to mention his
communication and leadership skills I
know
anyway Pam just needs to move on it's
already been a month since Rick got his
new position
what happened at lunch today a Pam
congratulated brick on his promotion be
Pam talked about quitting her job see
Pam complained about Rick getting a
promotion answer see

ago answer B what is the speaker's
opinion of the promotion a brick
deserved the promotion be Ric stole the

quit her job answer a
some people think of slang as street
talk but slang doesn't necessarily have
to include offensive language and
incorrect grammar the slang that I
present in these lessons is simply
informal English it's used everyday in a
variety of situations most commonly
among friends this informal language is
generally not appropriate for academic
and professional use my advice is to
listen to the news watch films and pay
attention when people speak and soon
you'll gain a better understanding of
when slang is appropriate thanks for
watching and happy studies
